column4: Any reason the root user on ubuntu would be able to open PDFs and not other users?
sure, if the read permission bits on the file are set poorly.
the permissions on the PDF file are definitely ok for the user
and the containing directory?
yep
don't suppose we can get you to paste some details?
they can read and write all files in their home folders (the same goes for all 30 users we have on this server) - it's just the root user that can open PDFs. All other file types seem ok
how are they attempting to open the pdfs?
just a double click
thanks for helping btw
can we get an example permissions list?
I think you might be on to something actually
just double checking permissions now
the permissions did seem wrong but that is corrected and the problem remains
anything else to help troubleshoot?
can we get an example permissions list?
If I ls -l or right click I can see the permissions are now correct
the user and group is both cman1
the permissions are now correct... can you help me troubleshoot a little further please
you expect me to spend my time helping, and then ignore any question i put to you. you've wasted enough of my time, i think.
I said please and pointed out that the permissions were now correct... How would you like your favoured evidence of a "permissions list"
i wouldn't. i have other things that need doing.
